unnormalised: **Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Interest Across India**
normalised: Good news for all you sun-loving folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is still offering sweet deals on solar rooftop installations. That's right, subsidies are available, making switching to solar power even more wallet-friendly.

unnormalised: Good news for all you sun-loving folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still offering sweet deals on solar rooftop installations. That's right, subsidies are available, making switching to solar power even more wallet-friendly.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, a leading renewable energy expert from I I T-Delhi, says "The subsidies, especially for smaller residential projects, make a huge difference. Think of it like free chole bhature after a hard day's work, but for your energy bills!"

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a leading renewable energy expert from IIT-Delhi, says "The subsidies, especially for smaller residential projects, make a HUGE difference. Think of it like free chole bhature after a hard day's work, but for your energy bills!"
normalised: The central government scheme offers subsidies up to forty percent for systems up to three kilowatt. For larger installations (three kilowatt to ten kilowatt), it drops a bit. States like Gujarat are also throwing in their own top-up subsidies!

unnormalised: The central government scheme offers subsidies up to 40% for systems up to 3 kW. For larger installations (3kW to 10kW), it drops a bit. States like Gujarat are also throwing in their own top-up subsidies!
normalised: Many families in cities like Pune and Bangalore are already benefiting. Missus Patel from Andheri installed a five kilowatt system on her one thousand two hundred square feet terrace and says her electricity bill has been slashed by more than half! Think of all the extra Diwali sweets you can buy with those savings!

unnormalised: Many families in cities like Pune and Bangalore are already benefiting. Mrs. Patel from Andheri installed a 5kW system on her 1200 sq ft terrace and says her electricity bill has been slashed by more than half! Think of all the extra Diwali sweets you can buy with those savings!
normalised: Applications can be made through the national portal. Don't delay, folks, these subsidies won't last forever! Check it out and go solar. Rupees saved is Rupees earned, as they say! This could be the sunshine in your budget you've been waiting for!

unnormalised: Applications can be made through the national portal. Don't delay, folks, these subsidies won't last forever! Check it out and go solar. Rs. saved is Rs. earned, as they say! This could be the sunshine in your budget you've been waiting for!
